triples.name: Precision and recall
triples.relevance: Precision and recall are core classification metrics analyzed in this paper for their behavior under varying prevalence and reference standard quality.

triples.name: Phi coefficient
triples.relevance: The Matthews correlation coefficient (MCC) is based on the phi coefficient and is the primary metric evaluated for robustness to prevalence variations.

triples.name: Sensitivity and specificity
triples.relevance: Sensitivity and specificity are key evaluation metrics for binary classification analyzed in this paper alongside other accuracy metrics.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: F1 score is one of the popular accuracy metrics examined in this paper for sensitivity to variations in prevalence and reference standard quality.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: The paper focuses specifically on binary classification scenarios and the behavior of associated accuracy metrics.

triples.name: Positive and negative predictive values
triples.relevance: Negative Predictive Value (NPV) is one of the accuracy metrics analyzed for prevalence dependence in this study.

triples.name: Likelihood-ratio test
triples.relevance: Likelihood ratios are among the classification accuracy metrics evaluated in this paper for robustness to prevalence variations.

triples.name: Remote sensing
triples.relevance: Remote sensing is cited as an application domain where simulations were conducted to evaluate accuracy metric behavior with realistic data quality values.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a comprehensive analysis framework for understanding how confusion matrix-derived metrics are affected by prevalence and reference standard quality, challenging assumptions about metric reliability.
